title: Weed-Control Machines - Harvest Farm Whately MA

tasks.task: Operating a farm with brassica crops and managing weed control.
subtasks: Conversational introduction (discarded as non-relevant; part of social pleasantries).

tasks.task: Implementing a multi-year crop rotation program.
subtasks: Addressing persistent weed pressure despite rotation.
Mentioning methods for controlling weeds, including herbicides and hand hoeing.
Employing pre-emergent herbicides for direct-seeded crops.

tasks.task: Performing cultivation with a cub tractor and tools.
subtasks: Using buddling cages for initial cultivation.
Adapting tools (e.g., old barn teeth) for soil fragmentation.
Adjusting cultivator tools for hilling and topdressing.
Integrating fertilization with weed control practices.

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Operating a vegetable farm focusing on brassica crops (collard greens, kale, etc.) with emphasis on weed control and cultivation.
Managing a three-year crop rotation to mitigate diseases and weeds.
subtasks: Rotating crops every three years to prevent disease buildup and suppress weeds.
Using herbicides for initial weed suppression in direct-seeded crops.
Employing hand hoeing in particularly weedy fields (though aiming to reduce this).
Combining cultivation techniques with selective herbicide applications.
Using a cub tractor equipped with buddling cages for initial soil preparation and weed removal between rows.
Adjusting cultivator tools (e.g., sweeps, shanks) to create hilled furrows and topdress fertilizers.
Addressing uneven soil conditions (e.g., clods) with adapted tools to protect crops.

tasks.task: Maintaining smooth, straight field surfaces for efficient tractor operations.
subtasks: Leveling the field after initial cultivations to ensure even tractor passes.

tasks.task: Applying fertilizers through cultivation to support crop growth.
